org.rapidcontext.core.task

Class Task

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.TimerTask
      • org.rapidcontext.core.task.Task
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public abstract class Task
extends java.util.TimerTask
    A scheduled background task. This class handles execution of a single task and provides some simple accessors for information about it.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Per Cederberg

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      java.lang.String id
      The unique task identifier.
      long lastExecutionTime
      The last execution time (in milliseconds since Epoch) of the task.
      long nextExecutionTime
      The next scheduled execution time (in milliseconds since Epoch) of the task.
      long schedulerPeriod
      The recurring scheduler period.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Task(java.lang.String id)
      Creates a new scheduler task with the provided unique id.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean cancel()
      Cancels this scheduled task.
      abstract void execute()
      Executes this task.
      void run()
      Executes this task and updates the scheduling timers.

      • Methods inherited from class java.util.TimerTask

        scheduledExecutionTime

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • id

        public java.lang.String id
        The unique task identifier. This is used to prevent scheduling multiple instances of the same task.

      • lastExecutionTime

        public long lastExecutionTime
        The last execution time (in milliseconds since Epoch) of the task. This value is set each time the task execution begins. Before the first run, this value will be zero (0).

      • nextExecutionTime

        public long nextExecutionTime
        The next scheduled execution time (in milliseconds since Epoch) of the task. This is an approximate value, adjusted both when task execution begins and when it terminates. The value will be set to zero (0) when a single-run task begins execution or when a recurring task is canceled.

      • schedulerPeriod

        public long schedulerPeriod
        The recurring scheduler period. This is non-zero if this task is scheduled for recurring execution.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Task

        public Task(java.lang.String id)
        Creates a new scheduler task with the provided unique id. The identifier is used to prevent scheduling multiple versions of the same task.
        Parameters:
        id - the unique task identifier

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public final void run()
        Executes this task and updates the scheduling timers. This method also ensures proper logging of exceptions, etc.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Specified by:
        run in class java.util.TimerTask

      • execute

        public abstract void execute()
                      throws java.lang.Exception
        Executes this task.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if an error occurred during the execution

      • cancel

        public boolean cancel()
        Cancels this scheduled task. This method is safe to call multiple times.
        Overrides:
        cancel in class java.util.TimerTask
        Returns:
        true if the task was canceled, or false if it were no longer scheduled (already canceled)
